title: India, Sri Lanka to Host 2026 T20 World Cup
byline: Pakistan’s Matches Shifted to Sri Lanka Amid Travel Restrictions.

title: Pakistan, Sri Lanka begin ODI battle today in Rawalpindi
byline: Sri Lanka will look to extend their winning run in white-ball cricket when they take on Pakistan in a three-match ODI series, starting Tuesday at the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium.

title: Sinner sweeps past Auger-Aliassime at ATP Finals
byline: Jannik Sinner began his ATP Finals title defence by sweeping aside a physically hampered Felix Auger-Aliassime in front of a passionate Turin crowd.

title: Sri Lankans rank third most unfit in South Asia
byline: Sri Lanka has been ranked third in South Asia for insufficient physical activity, according to a report by the World Health Organisation (WHO).

title: Sri Lanka chokes as transboundary pollution drives air quality down
byline: Air quality in several parts of Sri Lanka has plunged to unhealthy levels, driven by a mix of local pollution and smoke drifting from neighbouring nations, including northern India, experts warn.

title: A Crisis of Confusion, A Failure of Growth
byline: After listening to the 2026 budget speech, one thing became clear: this Government has no plan for economic growth.

title: Police launch special operations to curb rising vehicle thefts in Western Province
byline: Amid a growing number of motorcycle and three-wheeler thefts, the Sri Lanka Police have launched special operations across the Western Province, including Colombo City, to tackle the rising trend.

title: Remittances hit all-time high of  US $ 712mn  in October
byline: Sri Lanka received its highest ever monthly income of US $ 712.0 million from the workers’ remittances in October, signalling that the country is in for a bumper year of income from the Sri Lankans working abroad.

title: September private credit hits Rs.236bn; highest on record
byline: The licensed commercial banks extended a mammoth Rs.236.3 billion in new credit to the private sector in September 2025, marking a substantial 22.1 percent growth from a year earlier.

title: Tourism starts November with 13% growth
byline: Sri Lanka’s tourism industry has recorded a solid start to the winter season, welcoming 61,890 visitors during the first nine days of November 2025.

title: Even Montessori kid can fill treasury by overly taxing people: Sajith
byline: Claiming that the government is boasting of an overflowing treasury, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today that anyone, even a Montessori kid can fill the Treasury by overly taxing the people.

title: 5 Indian firms shortlisted for Sri Lanka digital ID contract
byline: The five systems operators shortlisted for Sri Lanka Unique Digital ID by the National Institute of Smart Government in India will be arriving in the island nation next week, top officials said.

title: Will unite with joint opposition at right time: Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) will unite with the joint opposition at the right time under agreement of policies and not for personal benefits.

title: Probe into MPs’ use of unparliamentary language during yesterday’s sessions: Speaker
byline: Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne said an investigation will be conducted by the office of the Secretary General of Parliament regarding the use of unparliamentary language used by some MPs during yesterday’s sessions.

title: MEPA introduces 5G-enabled water cleanup robot
byline: The Marine Environmental Protection Authority (MEPA) has taken steps to introduce a robotic machine capable of automatically collecting floating waste from water bodies.

title: I follow AKD in raising questions under Standing Order 27(2): Ravi K
byline: Opposition MP Ravi Karunanayake told Parliament today that he follows President Anura Kumara Dissanayake in raising questions of national importance under Standing Order 27(2).

title: Commotion in Parliament over issues in economic centres
byline: A commotion took place in Parliament when MP Dayasiri Jayasekera raised a question over the crisis that has occurred in economic centres where he said the work has come to a standstill. He said no buying and selling are taking place in economic centres.

title: Sajith, Vijitha condemn blast near New Delhi’s Red Fort
byline: Sri Lankan leaders have expressed condolences following a blast near New Delhi’s iconic Red Fort on Sunday, which killed nine people and is being investigated as a terror attack.

title: Mysterious death of student hours before A/L exam
byline: A 19-year-old schoolgirl who was due to sit for the G.C.E. Advanced Level examination yesterday(10) was found dead in her bed early last morning at her home in Ihala Arawwala, Dambulla, police said.

title: Suspect who raped and impregnated an underage girl arrested
byline: A suspect who had raped and impregnated an underage girl and went into hiding was arrested yesterday after more than a year by Monaragala Division Crime Investigation Unit.

title: Presidential media awards 2025 to honor journalists today
byline: The “Presidential Media Awards – 2025” will be held today at 3.00 pm at the Pokuna Theatre, under the patronage of Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, to recognize journalists for their contributions to a credible and responsible media.

title: Malaysia officials recover more bodies from capsized migrant boat
byline: At least 21 people are now known to have died after a boat carrying undocumented migrants sank near the Malaysian resort island of Langkawi, near the border with Thailand.

title: 42 per cent of women in Sri Lanka are overweight or obese
byline: Nearly 1 in 3 women (29.6 per cent) are overweight, and 1 in 8 (12.6 per cent) aged 18–60 years are obese in Sri Lanka according to the National Nutrition and Micronutrient Survey, with highest overweight and obesity rates being among women aged 50–60 years.

title: IRD reminds taxpayers of upcoming deadlines for 2024/2025 assessment year
byline: The Inland Revenue Department (IRD) has issued a reminder to taxpayers regarding the upcoming deadlines for income tax returns and related tax payments for the 2024/2025 assessment year.

title: New ’Lucifer’ bee with devil-like horns found in Australia
byline: Australian scientists have discovered a new native bee species with tiny horns - and given it a suitably devilish name.

title: RTI Commission failed to address 308 requests for information last year
byline: The Right to Information Commission has failed to attend to 308 requests for information from January 1, 2025, to September 30, 2025, it was revealed yesterday.

title: Trump threatens BBC with legal action over Panorama speech edit
byline: Donald Trump has threatened legal action against the BBC, following criticism over how a speech the US president made was edited and used in a Panorama documentary.

title: Legal action to be taken over 7,000 unrenewed firearm licenses
byline: Legal action is to be taken against over 7,000 firearm owners who have failed to renew their licenses with the Ministry of Defence last year.

title: Nyamhuri replaces injured Muzarabani as Zimbabwe announce squad for Tri-Series
byline: Uncapped pacer Newman Nyamhuri has been drafted into Zimbabwe’s 15-member squad for the Pakistan T20I Tri-Series, replacing the injured Blessing Muzarabani. Hosts Pakistan and Sri Lanka will join Zimbabwe in the high-stakes tri-nation clash.

title: Appeal Court orders to curb air pollution in Jaffna Municipality area
byline: The Court of Appeal today directed the relevant authorities, including the Jaffna Municipal Council, to take necessary measures to reduce air pollution within the municipal area, particularly by refraining from burning garbage, in accordance with the Gazette notification issued in 2017.

title: Five-year dog population control plan to be launched in Kataragama
byline: The Association of Veterinarians for Humane Management of Animal Population is set to launch a five-year plan to control the dog population within the Kataragama Pradeshiya Sabha, aiming to reduce rabies risks and promote animal welfare.

title: Taavi Samaraweera makes history with world no. 3 ranking in U-11 Table Tennis
byline: Sri Lanka’s rising table tennis star, Taavi Samaraweera, has etched his name in history by becoming the world’s No. 3 in the latest Under-11 Boys’ World Table Tennis Rankings — the highest-ever ranking achieved by a Sri Lankan player at any age category.

title: 14 new check-in counters launched at BIA
byline: Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited (AASL) has announced that 14 new check-in counters have been introduced on a trial basis at the newly built marquee at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA).

title: AMS slams Govt inaction over longstanding injustices
byline: The Association of Medical Specialists (AMS) has voiced deep frustration over what it calls “decades of unresolved injustices” endured by Sri Lanka’s medical specialists, urging the government to take immediate corrective action.

title: Blast outside Islamabad court in Pakistan kills at least 12
byline: An explosion has killed at least 12 people and injured several others outside a court building in Pakistan’s capital Islamabad, police say.

title: Rohitha cites Daily Mirror article to highlight situation in country
byline: Opposition MP Rohitha Abeygunawardhane cited in his speech the article titled ’’Sri Lanka is the secondmost expensive country in South Asia to live in’’ published in the Daily Mirror newspaper recently to highlight the situation in the country.

title: Court orders expeditious release of 625 BYD vehicles held by Sri Lanka Customs
byline: The Court of Appeal directed the Sri Lanka Customs (SLC) to expeditiously release 625 BYD vehicles detained by the Customs, subject to respective bank guarantees and corporate guarantees, as set out in a motion filed by the Sri Lanka Customs.

title: Govt to build Rs.170m indoor stadium in North
byline: Recognizing the importance of promoting sports and improving infrastructure in the Northern Province, which continues to recover from decades of conflict, the government has approved the construction of a new indoor sports stadium in the region.

title: Cabinet approves vehicle procurement for Prisons Department
byline: The government has taken steps to strengthen the operational capacity of the Department of Prisons by approving the purchase of essential vehicles required for its duties related to court operations and inmate welfare.

title: Cabinet approves development of key Multi-Modal Transport Hubs across the country
byline: In line with the government’s national policy to modernize and streamline public transport, plans have been set in motion to establish a series of multi-modal transport hubs across the country. The initiative aims to enhance efficiency by connecting various modes of transport—such as buses, trains, and taxis—within key transit and main cities.

title: Facebook fraudster makes thousands by selling pages with stolen photos
byline: A suspect who had created Facebook pages using women’s photographs and earned money through social media activities was produced before court today after being arrested by the Cyber Crimes Division of the Criminal Investigation Department.

title: First-ever brown sugar retail network launched in Nugegoda
byline: The Lanka Sugar Company, operating under the Ministry of Industries and Enterprise Development, today (Nov. 11) inaugurated its first-ever brown sugar retail network in Nugegoda.

title: A/L student injured after jumping from school building in Bambalapitiya
byline: A 19-year-old Advanced Level student has been hospitalized after jumping from the third floor of her school building in Bambalapitiya this afternoon (11), according to police.

title: Ramith Rambukwella raises middle finger outside court
byline: Social media erupted today after a video showed Ramith Rambukwella, son of MP Keheliya Rambukwella, raising his middle finger at reporters outside the Colombo High Court shortly after being served with indictments.

title: ASPI extends gains as earnings season boosts investor confidence
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) continued its positive momentum, closing the session on a bullish note as investor confidence strengthened on the back of robust corporate earnings. As of 11th November, 117 companies have released their quarterly results, collectively posting LKR 73.7 billion in net profits, marking a 23.1% QoQ growth and a 51.5% YoY increase.

title: GMOA warns of deepening crisis in health sector
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has warned that Sri Lanka’s free health system is facing a severe crisis, accusing the 2026 Budget of failing to address chronic issues such as shortages of staff, medicines, and essential medical equipment.

title: MP Archuna creates havoc in Parliament
byline: MP Ramanathan Archuna created havoc in Parliament today by objecting the decision of the chair to allow Deputy Minister Arun Hemachandra to raise a point of order.

title: Tamil Mirror wins Best Cartoonist of the Year award
byline: Tamil Mirror cartoonist Namal Amarasinghe was honoured with the Best Cartoon (Editorial Cartoon) award at this year’s Presidential Media Awards.

title: Court extends interim order preventing arrest of ex-Army intelligence officer
byline: The Court of Appeal further extended its interim order preventing the arrest of a former member of the Sri Lanka Army Intelligence Service without obtaining the advice of the Attorney General, in connection with a CID investigations into the Easter Sunday bomb attacks.

title: Daily Mirror shines at Presidential Media Awards
byline: The Daily Mirror triumphed at this year’s Presidential Media Awards, securing accolades in three major categories - Best Cartoon, Best Feature Article, and Best Investigative Press.

title: Strong revenue key as SL stays committed to debt reduction: Fitch
byline: Sri Lanka’s latest budget reaffirms the government’s commitment to reducing debt as a share of GDP over the medium term, according to Fitch Ratings, which noted that strong revenue performance will remain vital for meeting fiscal goals.
